DIRECTOR BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT

SUMMARY

Specializing in sales related business, global account management and new business development.
Provide proven results-based and relationship-building skills to a dynamic sales organization and combine entrepreneurial drive with business-management skills to propel gains in revenue, market share and profit performance.
Employ extensive International experience and in-depth knowledge of Aerospace & Defense, Computing, Industrial and Telecom markets.
Cultivate excellent relationships with existing customers and new prospects.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Corporate Responsibility Strategy Vice President

Location: New York, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  

CR Strategy serves as a key advisor and internal consulting function for Corporate Responsibility on a range of projects that address the top priorities of senior management and advance the mission of the department. Projects may include those related to strategic planning, organizational design, strategic business deep dives, and cross-line of business initiatives within CR and across the firm.

The Corporate Responsibility (CR) department mission is to advance a stronger, more durable and safe financial system and an inclusive economy and society for clients, customers and communities around the world. The department includes sub-departments focused on policy advocacy and lobbying, philanthropy, sustainability, impact finance, community engagement and data analysis and research.

As a Corporate Responsibility Strategy Manager, you will help lead project teams in solving complex problems and implementation issues critical to the company.

Job Responsibilities

Define and deconstruct problems in order to drive solutionsPrioritize issues, analysis and team capacityStructure and build quantitative and qualitative / conceptual analysesApply strong judgment to surface implications and practical, high-impact solutionsLeverage public and non-public services to perform competitor / industry researchSimultaneously work on multiple projects within the department as well as those that extend to Lines of Business, Corporate functions and strategy organizations across the firmIdentify and communicate the strategic implications and key takeaways of data and analysisInfrequent domestic and international travel as needed for project-based work

Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills

At least 6 years of diverse problem-solving experience with a management consulting firm or on an in-house strategy team; 1+ years leading projectsStrong interpersonal and influencing skills and ability to interact with colleagues at all levels in a peer-like wayAbility to communicate effectively and confidently (both oral and written)Excellent and efficient PowerPoint and Excel skillsOutstanding judgment, organizational skills, and independent decision-making ability

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills

Experience applying data analysis to solve business problems in fast-moving environmentExperience with cross-functional collaboration, including influencing stakeholders and working with diverse teamsExperience working in or exposure to philanthropy, government, non-profit or policy organizations is a plus

Experience Level (if available): Executive
<JD_END>
